005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.model.validation;
007
008import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.model.constraint.IConstraint.Level;
009
010import java.util.Collections;
011import java.util.List;
012
013import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
014
015/**
016 * Provides data that is the result of a completed content validation.
017 */
018public interface IValidationResult {
019  @NonNull
020  IValidationResult PASSING_RESULT = new IValidationResult() {
021
022    @Override
023    public boolean isPassing() {
024      return true;
025    }
026
027    @Override
028    public Level getHighestSeverity() {
029      return Level.INFORMATIONAL;
030    }
031
032    @SuppressWarnings("null")
033    @Override
034    public List<? extends IValidationFinding> getFindings() {
035      return Collections.emptyList();
036    }
037  };
038
039  /**
040   * Determines if the result of validation was valid or not.
041   *
042   * @return {@code true} if the result was determined to be valid or
043   *         {@code false} otherwise
044   */
045  default boolean isPassing() {
046    return getHighestSeverity().ordinal() < Level.ERROR.ordinal();
047  }
048
049  /**
050   * Get the highest finding severity level for the validation. The level
051   * {@link Level#INFORMATIONAL} will be returned if no validation findings were
052   * identified.
053   *
054   * @return the highest finding severity level
055   */
056  @NonNull
057  Level getHighestSeverity();
058
059  /**
060   * Get the list of validation findings, which may be empty.
061   *
062   * @return the list
063   */
064  @NonNull
065  List<? extends IValidationFinding> getFindings();
066}
